scenario_name: Asymmetric Flap Jam due to Drive Mechanism Failure
description: A latent mechanical fault in the right wing flap drive mechanism, inadequately addressed in prior maintenance, manifests during final approach, causing an asymmetric flap condition and forcing a go-around.

telemetry_events.description: When flap lever is moved from CONF 2 to CONF 3, the right flap jams.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Flap retraction appears slower than normal after takeoff.
maintenance_logs.action: Ground function test performed, no faults found. SFCC reset. Aircraft released for service.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Audible 'strange squeaking noise' from right wing during flap extension for landing.
maintenance_logs.action: Visual inspection of RH flap tracks 4 & 5 revealed no cracks. Tracks lubricated per AMM. Ground function test satisfactory.

transcript.sound: Loud, dry 'CLUNK' sound from right side.

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: ECAM warning... Flap System Fault... and... Flaps Locked. We have an asymmetric flap.

transcript.speaker: PF
transcript.dialogue: I have control. Go-around. PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN...

context_data.weather: VMC (Visual Meteorological Conditions), light winds, no turbulence or icing conditions.
context_data.flight_phase_details: Final Approach, ILS Rwy 25L, 2500 ft, 8 NM from threshold.
context_data.atc_communication: [Callsign], executing a go-around, we have a flight control issue, request vectors to hold for troubleshooting.
